title: Operating Systems Quiz
description: Quiz covering operating systems concepts and administration.

questions.text: Which command is used to list running processes in Unix-like systems?
questions.explanation: The ps command reports a snapshot of current processes in Unix-like systems.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'ifconfig' command?
questions.explanation: ifconfig is used to configure the kernel-resident network interfaces.

questions.text: Hashing is a form of encryption.
questions.explanation: Hashing is a one-way function used to ensure data integrity, while encryption is a two-way function used to protect data confidentiality.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of heuristic-based antivirus software?
questions.explanation: Heuristic-based antivirus software detects malware based on suspicious behavior.
wrongAnswers: Is less effective against new malware

questions.text: What is the purpose of Tripwire?
questions.explanation: Tripwire is a security and data integrity tool for monitoring and alerting on specific file changes.

questions.text: cmd is a Unix shell.
questions.explanation: cmd is the command-line interpreter in Windows, while bash is a Unix shell.

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid shell operator for output redirection?
questions.explanation: > is used for output redirection, overwriting the target file.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the /etc/resolv.conf file in Unix-like systems?
questions.explanation: The /etc/resolv.conf file contains DNS resolver information.

questions.text: Which command is used to display the IP configuration in Windows?
questions.explanation: ipconfig is used to display the IP configuration in Windows.

questions.text: The Windows Registry is a hierarchical database that stores configuration settings and options on Microsoft Windows operating systems.
questions.explanation: The Windows Registry is a hierarchical database that stores configuration settings and options on Microsoft Windows operating systems.

questions.text: Which registry hive stores settings specific to the local computer?
questions.explanation: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) stores settings specific to the local computer.

questions.text: What is the purpose of code signing?
questions.explanation: Code signing is used to verify the authenticity and integrity of software.

questions.text: A device driver enables a network device to communicate between the computer and operating system.
questions.explanation: A device driver enables a network device to communicate between the computer and operating system, and with other network computers and devices.

questions.text: Which directory typically stores log files in Unix-like systems?
questions.explanation: Logs are stored by default in /var/log/ in Unix-like systems.

questions.text: Which of the following is an executable file extension in Windows?
questions.explanation: .exe is a common executable file extension in Windows.

questions.text: The /etc/shadow file contains password hashes for all users on a Unix-like system.
questions.explanation: The /etc/shadow file contains password hashes for each user that has logged onto the machine

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'tasklist' command in Windows?
questions.explanation: tasklist displays a list of currently running processes on the local computer or a remote computer.

questions.text: Which command is used to display the routing table in Linux?
questions.explanation: The 'route' command is used to display the routing table in Linux.

questions.text: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) prevents the execution of data.
questions.explanation: Data Execution Prevention (DEP): System level memory protection that prevents the execution of data.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the Windows File Protection (WFP) feature?
questions.explanation: Windows File Protection (WFP) prevents the replacement of protected system files.
correctAnswers: Prevent replacement of protected system files
